channel.title: Stackable items
channel.description:
Currently all runes (item codes: 555 556 557 558 554) and stuff like hand cannon shots, etc. do not stack. If you do ::item 555 28 you will get a full inventory of water runes. Same with a bunch of different items.
What/Where could i go to manually make the items stackable? YES, i've looked on google. NO it did not help. Most of the tuts were based off of PI. Im using Julias client.
EDIT: I Have found this? its in Items.java, how shall i go about proceeding with making items stackable?
[IMG]http://i60.tinypic.com/ncxrn9.jpg[/img]

item.title: Stackable items
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Deadforce, post:7, topic:550293”]Yes i know :D. I’ve been watching videos and reading up on it. Stuff like asking questions really does seem to help me expand my knowledge :p. I appreciate the help

EDIT: Do you know any sources with decent coding thats not “piss poor”?[/quote]

Well, idk about Julia, as I said, but stay away from PI and Delta.
Those are your two biggest contenders in the shit code area.

Hyperion is good, RuneSource is good, I believe Asteria (based on runesource) is too). There are others I just can’t think of their names.

Read full topic

item.title: Stackable items
item.dc:creator: @Deadforce Deadforce
item.description:
@Deadforce wrote:

Yes i know :D. I’ve been watching videos and reading up on it. Stuff like asking questions really does seem to help me expand my knowledge :p. I appreciate the help

EDIT: Do you know any sources with decent coding thats not “piss poor”?

Read full topic

item.title: Stackable items
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Deadforce:

Alright! When I find it I can post what I find?

Yeah I don’t see why not…

Deadforce:

Notice I’m not so good at Java. I have been learning slower over past week though

Ahh, the rookie mistake…

RSPS is in no way a good place to start learning.
Reason for that is most tutorials you will see, along with most code in servers (Not saying Julia whatsoever) will be piss poor in terms of OOP (Object Oriented Programming).

It is alright to tinker with a RSPS while learning Java. But do not try to learn Java through RSPS.

If you do not like the Java language, or parts of it… RSPS might not be the area for you, as there are like 2 servers out there not written in Java and literally nothing has come from them.

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/index.html < The oracle tutorial website. Best place to find anything on Java, as they’re the company that owns the rights.

Read full topic

item.title: Stackable items
item.dc:creator: @Deadforce Deadforce
item.description:
@Deadforce wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:550293”]As I don’t have a copy of Julia, I can’t say exactly.

I’d assume you could look for a file name ItemDefinition.java, and then see how it is loading the defs. And from there, you can figure out how/where to make changes.[/quote]

Alright! When I find it I can post what I find?

Notice I’m not so good at Java. I have been learning slower over past week though

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

As I don’t have a copy of Julia, I can’t say exactly.

I’d assume you could look for a file name ItemDefinition.java, and then see how it is loading the defs. And from there, you can figure out how/where to make changes.

item.title: Stackable items
item.dc:creator: @Deadforce Deadforce
item.description:
@Deadforce wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:550293”]It’s both server and client sided.

Client sided you edit the item definitions to make the item stackable (usually quite literally a boolean named “stackable”).

And then server sided, you use basically what you just found…
But the actual ItemDefinitions and not the code you posted (Probably in an external file.)[/quote]

Okay so what should the code look like on the server side? What do I add in?

On the client side I’ll look in a bit when I’m on my computer. Thanks for helping

Read full topic

item.title: Stackable items
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It’s both server and client sided.

Client sided you edit the item definitions to make the item stackable (usually quite literally a boolean named “stackable”).

And then server sided, you use basically what you just found…
But the actual ItemDefinitions and not the code you posted (Probably in an external file.)

Read full topic
